item.title: I lost my boy, but he’s finally home.
item.description:
It was suggested that I try to post about this again. The last 3 months have been some of the most devastating of my life. Losing my boy Peter Paul, has taken a huge toll on me. My vet is amazing and they were able to help me get him cremated... with his paw prints and tail print ?? My health declines and Peter Paul's brother, Deeble, is still battling an abscess. I have an out of pocket cost I have to pay by the 15th in order to continue my occupational therapy and regain normal function in my right arm. As an artist this is... important, to say the least. Deeble has a veterinary appt on Friday the 13th and it's going to be a hard one guys, l'm not gonna lie. I might have a really hard decision to make. I feel alone and scared but this community had been so beautifully welcoming, supportive and empathy towards my dealings with chronic illness, disability and pet struggles. I'm sharing my ko fi link for if anyone likes art, rats, or feels like helping out if they can spare it https://ko-fi.com/darkratlord My direct Paypl is @sillygooseinc I'm at a loss and cannot afford pride at this time. Thank you so much for reading and to anyone who has kept up with us. My brain feels like it is short circuiting with pain but there has to be another side, right? Have a good day imgurians
This rainbow bridge poem killed me.
My deebs <3
He gives kisssses
Drew this in the mental hospital
He takes his medicine so good
☹️☹️☹️?
I miss you so much
item.dc:creator: DarkRatLord3000

“Nothing limits intelligence more than ignorance; nothing fosters ignorance more than one's own opinions; nothing strengthens opinions more than refusing to look at reality.” - Sheri S. Tepper So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! Here's the new one https://discord.gg/NPStJGgARq - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work, zero income. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've honestly been my lifeline. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me

item.title: Illinois Police Tackle Students During ICE Protest Walkout
item.description: Police violently tackle teenagers peacefully protesting ICE—give them concussion slamming heads into sidewalk. "They're just kids!" woman filming shouts at officers. "They hit them in the head! He's gonna get a concussion—from hitting the concrete!" "What did they even do?" The incident occurred outside East Aurora High School in Aurora, Illinois—about 35 miles west of Chicago.

item.title: My first Valentine’s Day without her
item.description: She’s gone and I am lost. 35 years together and 34 married. I can’t go into a store and see all the Valentine’s Day stuff. She passed in May this year. I thought I was okay, or at least better. But I’m drowning and the waves keep getting higher. We never did anything big Valentine’s Day thing, but I always did something sappy like filling our bedroom with red and pink balloons before she woke up or covered the mirrors with hearts. Silly I know, but it made her smile and that made me happy. I know she had to go, but I didn’t want her to. We were supposed to get old together. All I can do is cry and hold the granddaughter she missed by 5 months.
item.dc:creator: reallefty

item.title: The Story of Rizzo
item.description:
Sweet Rizzo, the short, stocky, and resilient pupper. I unchained this sweet soul from the bed of this truck, not knowing what was going to happen. Thankfully, we looked at each other and knew it was ok. The owner was a senior, uneducated, and underprivileged, and under-resourced, living in rural Alabama. Sometimes, we rescuers need to go in with no judgment, simply to save those who need us most. I’m so thankful that this older gentleman came and sought out help.
Not knowing what was wrong with his skin or whether he had anything contagious, I immediately gowned up, scooped him up with loving arms, and brought him to safety. It’s not easy to adopt out bully breeds, especially living in the deep south of America. That doesn’t matter to me, and it doesn't matter to our rescue. We help those who need it, and we will make the room and find the resources to do it.
With love, compassion, MEDICATION, and patience, sweet Rizzo grew to be a mighty and goofy lap dog. It wasn’t long after sharing his story and advocating for him he found his furever home he deserved with a furry forever, four legged friend.. Cheers to Rizzo and his new life. May all the pooches who get adopted be loved like this.
#rescueismyfavoritebreed
item.dc:creator: AlabamaAnimalRescuer

item.title: You have a derangement syndrome!!1!!1!!
item.description:
This whole deposition was genuinely infuriating to watch. When she deflected right into talking about how the "DOW was at a historic high." Like, we're not here to fucking talk about the DOW, we're here to fucking talk about how your office is clearly covering up one of the largest sex trafficking rings in history.
Note the part was when she was being spoken to by that older blonde woman with short hair. The woman was like okay well back to you... And Bondi replies, "Oh yes of course back to me." All angry. The woman was like, "Yes back to you. It's YOUR trial! This is about you!" Bondi goes beyond insufferable. She is clearly drunk or on something, slurring half the time as well. It's an embarrassment.
It’s a hallmark of fascism. All that Trump glazing wasn’t meant for us, they were meant for Trump. It’s been studied and proven: the people that go far/survive the longest in dictatorships and other autocratic regimes are the ones willing to go on record and make fools of themselves in service of the big guy. The thinking is by willingly (and unprompted) smearing shit on themselves on camera in the name of the boss, they demonstrate their undying loyalty. The ones with independence, “integrity” or opinions don’t last long (see Ernst Rohm)

item.title: George Carlin, 2007: "Power does what it wants". Although about Bush and Patriot Act, it's so prescient and brilliantly insightful of our moment in time.
item.description: Full Carlin quote: “I think power does what it wants.  Power does what it wants.  And now they are just more naked about it.  Now they just put it right out front and say this is what we are doing to you, folks.  This country is finished.  It been sliding down hill a long time.  And everybody has got a cell phone that makes pancakes so they don‘t want to rock the boat.  They don‘t want to make any trouble. People have been bought off by gizmos and toys in this country, and no one questions things anymore.” This is the full 7+ minutes, timestamped to this moment, but if you want to watch the entire Olbermann interview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ULfTx1n2yBA&t=400s

item.title: The Story of Gilly
item.description:
Good morning, new friends! I wanted to share a unique story about Gilly. A sweet and ambitious sphinx who found herself homeless after a backyard breeding operation gone wrong. Has anyone heard of FIP? FIP is now detectable and treatable thanks to modern medicine!! I love this little gargoyle.
Immediately after I saved her, I took her to the one and only Dr. Wesley, the Greater Huntsville Humane Society’s Shelter veterinarian. Quick sidebar: this guy goes above and beyond, clears his schedule, and ensures rescue animals receive the best care. We found out not only that she was FIP-positive, but also that she had three parasites that were contagious not only to other animals but also to humans. At four months old, no animals should have to go through all of this, but unfortunately, Gilly did. Did I tell you she had a dislocated hip? Ughhh
With all of the things and all of the symptoms, she faced them all. G.I. was upset, had inflammation from infections, and was hospitalized at the ER for 4 days, but somehow pulled through. The sweet Foster cat of mine has given us a ride on a roller coaster we were not prepared for. Luckily, our supporters and team are amazing, and we were able to pull through.
She's out! After she crashed, she needed to stay with the team. I took her back home after this. The staff said, “When your chicken breast is on the loose,” haha, she's a character. I love her and want her, buuuttttt I can't keep on keeping them. There's more to save!
She is now back home, receiving her life-saving medication, not once, but for a second round. I will go to Great Lengths to make sure she survives this to go to her forever home! Fun fact: a celebrity may or may not be adopting her after a clear bill of health ?. Pray for Gilly and pray that she continues to thrive and become healthy.
item.dc:creator: AlabamaAnimalRescuer

item.title: First Time Home Buyer
item.description: After what felt like the single longest January ever, to the point that it still feels like January, a milestone has been achieved. The end of my first home buying experience, and hopefully the end to all the stress, anxiety and sleepless nights as well. (Y'all, I'm running on 4 hours of sleep that 2 hot coffees, 1 canned cold brew latte, and a 16oz energy drink simply could not touch. I think I'm delirious right now.) It's officially official - with the key to my own home. (Blurred for safety.) I would absolutely love to hibernate for a month, catch up on sleep and meditate, but instead I'll have to settle for about 9.5 days while I move and set up the new home. cheers! #firsthome #newyearnewme #imsotired
item.dc:creator: tinythunder

item.title: Intro to ME
item.description: Hey y’all, I found this amazing platform through a feline foster who is doing amazing work. @KittensForDays What an amazing community I have witnessed and I hope to be a part of. I am a dad, husband, an animal rescuer in the deep south of the United States. I spend the majority of my time, saving homeless animals and providing life-saving programs for people and pets in need. I hope you won't mind my four legged and sometimes three legged posts ??
item.dc:creator: AlabamaAnimalRescuer
